communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Quincy Delight Jones Jr. (March 14, 1933 – November 3, 2024), famed Producer, songwriter, and musician (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quincy_Jones).

Please see the following major news article reporting on Quincy Jones' passing as proof of death: https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/04/entertainment/quincy-jones-obit/index.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Quincy Delight Jones Jr. (March 14, 1933 – November 3, 2024), famed Producer, songwriter, and musician (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quincy_Jones).

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. For reference, the associated file numbers for these records provided by the FBI are: 161-HQ-12494, 100-HQ-127094 Serial HQ1022, 100-HQ-481695 Serial HQ539, 100-HQ-459279, and 105-WF-20251 Serial 24.

Please see the following major news article reporting on Quincy Jones' passing as proof of death: https://www.cnn.com/2024/11/04/entertainment/quincy-jones-obit/index.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
